result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikendra L Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically anger management and cognitive intervention. No contact, directly or indirectly, with RP.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes: Must serve 3 months. Balance is stayed.   AMENDED 01-23-2017:  Lift of stayed conditional time - defendant to serve 90 days with credit for time served from 01-02-2017.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Not eligible for huber, bracelet, or good time.   **AMENDED 10-29-2019:  Sentence is stayed pending further order of the Court.**
**Amended on 11-26-19: To reflect a time served sentence.**
Concurrent with: Counts 3, 4, 5.
